overview: The purpose of this measure is to establish the Accessory Dwelling Unit Financing and Deed Restriction Program to allocate funds to the counties to provide grants to eligible homeowners or homebuyers to finance construction costs, development costs, and non-reoccurring closing costs associated with the construction of an accessory dwelling unit and purchase deed restrictions on such property (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). The bill permits the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to allocate funds from the Dwelling Unit Revolving Fund for this purpose (HB740_HD2). In response to testimony from the Department of the Attorney General, this version of the measure has been amended by "Inserting appropriate standards for grant awards" (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_).
agency_impact: The Department of the Attorney General previously testified that the measure did "not appear to contain legally sufficient standards for the award of such grants involving public money as required by the Hawaii State Constitution" (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). Accordingly, the bill was amended by "Inserting appropriate standards for grant awards" (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). The new standards require that, at a minimum, an applicant must agree to specific terms, including an agreement to "indemnify and save harmless the State and its officers, agents, and employees from and against any and all claims arising out of or resulting from activities carried out or projects undertaken with funds provided hereunder" (HB740_HD2).
policy_impact: The measure has been amended by "Inserting appropriate standards for grant awards" to address constitutional concerns raised by the Department of the Attorney General (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). A new subsection, ยง201H-B(d), was added to establish minimum requirements for grant applicants (HB740_HD2). The measure was also amended by "Clarifying the exemption from conveyance taxes," which now applies to "Any document or instrument conveying real property with a county-owned deed restriction...including any document or instrument conveying such a county-owned deed restriction" (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). The effective date remains July 1, 3000 (HB740_HD2).
operating_revenue_impact: The measure was amended by "Clarifying the exemption from conveyance taxes" (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). The exemption in section 247-3, Hawaii Revised Statutes, now explicitly applies to "Any document or instrument conveying real property with a county-owned deed restriction pursuant to subpart   , part III of chapter 201H, including any document or instrument conveying such a county-owned deed restriction" (HB740_HD2).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update from the previous version of the bill is the resolution of a constitutional issue raised by the Department of the Attorney General, which had testified that the measure did "not appear to contain legally sufficient standards for the award of such grants involving public money" (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). The current version addresses this by "Inserting appropriate standards for grant awards" into the bill (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). Additionally, the measure was amended by "Clarifying the exemption from conveyance taxes" to ensure the exemption applies to the instrument conveying the deed restriction itself (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_).
